unnormalised: The Common University Entrance Test (CUET) UG 2024 results were declared on 30/06/2024 by the National Testing Agency (NTA). This year, approximately 1.5 million students appeared for the exam, vying for seats in various central, state, and private universities across India. Delhi University (DU) is expected to release its cut-off list by the 2nd week of July, according to sources.
normalised: The Common University Entrance Test (C-U-E-T) U-G two thousand and twenty four results were declared on thirtieth June two thousand and twenty four by the National Testing Agency (N-T-A). This year, approximately one point five million students appeared for the exam, vying for seats in various central, state, and private universities across India. Delhi University (D-U) is expected to release its cut-off list by the second week of July, according to sources.

unnormalised: Admission criteria for many prestigious institutions, including JNU and BHU, are heavily reliant on CUET scores. Candidates are advised to regularly check the official websites of their preferred universities for detailed information on counselling schedules and document verification processes. The NTA has clarified that scorecards can be downloaded from the official CUET website using application number and DOB.
normalised: Admission criteria for many prestigious institutions, including J-N-U and B-H-U, are heavily reliant on C-U-E-T scores. Candidates are advised to regularly check the official websites of their preferred universities for detailed information on counselling schedules and document verification processes. The N-T-A has clarified that scorecards can be downloaded from the official C-U-E-T website using application number and D-O-B.

unnormalised: This year saw a notable increase of applicants from rural areas, with a reported 20% rise compared to the previous year. Experts suggest that the CUET has levelled the playing field, providing equal opportunities to students irrespective of their socio-economic background. Many students achieving 99 percentile are aiming for programs like B.Com (Hons) and BA English (Hons) at top DU colleges.
normalised: This year saw a notable increase of applicants from rural areas, with a reported twenty percent rise compared to the previous year. Experts suggest that the C-U-E-T has levelled the playing field, providing equal opportunities to students irrespective of their socio-economic background. Many students achieving ninety nine percentile are aiming for programs like B dot Com (Hons) and B-A English (Hons) at top D-U colleges.

unnormalised: Several universities like Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI) are also considering CUET scores for select undergraduate programs. With the admission season in full swing, students are urged to keep all necessary documents ready, including their Class 10th and 12th mark sheets, category certificates (if applicable), and CUET scorecard. The deadline for application varies for each university, typically ranging from 15/07/2024 to 31/07/2024.
normalised: Several universities like Jamia Millia Islamia (J-M-I) are also considering C-U-E-T scores for select undergraduate programs. With the admission season in full swing, students are urged to keep all necessary documents ready, including their Class tenth and twelfth mark sheets, category certificates (if applicable), and C-U-E-T scorecard. The deadline for application varies for each university, typically ranging from fifteenth July two thousand and twenty four to thirty first July two thousand and twenty four.
